parameter.name: expirationPolicy
parameter.description: Configures the minimum amount of time that a dynamic configuration instance can remain idle before the runtime considers it eligible for expiration. This does not mean that the platform will expire the instance at the exact moment that it becomes eligible. The runtime will actually purge the instances when it sees it fit.

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

parameter.name: reconnection
parameter.description: When the application is deployed, a connectivity test is performed on all connectors. If set to true, deployment will fail if the test doesn't pass after exhausting the associated reconnection strategy

operation.name: addPermission
operation.description: Adds a statement to a topic's access control policy, granting access for the specified AWS accounts to the specified actions.

parameter.name: topicArn
parameter.description: The ARN of the topic whose access control policy you wish to modify.

parameter.name: label
parameter.description: A unique identifier for the new policy statement.

parameter.name: accountIds
parameter.description: The AWS account IDs of the users (principals) who will be given access to the specified actions. The users must have AWS accounts, but do not need to be signed up for this service.

parameter.name: actionNames
parameter.description: The action you want to allow for the specified principal(s)

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: confirmSubscription
operation.description: The confirmSubscription action verifies an endpoint owner's intent to receive messages by validating the token sent to the endpoint by an earlier Subscribe action. If the token is valid, the action creates a new subscription and returns its Amazon Resource Name (ARN). This call requires an AWS signature only when the AuthenticateOnUnsubscribe flag is set to "true".

parameter.name: topicArn
parameter.description: The ARN of the topic for which you wish to confirm a subscription.

parameter.name: token
parameter.description: Short-lived token sent to an endpoint during the Subscribe action.

parameter.name: authenticateOnUnsubscribe
parameter.description: Disallows unauthenticated unsubscribes of the subscription. If the value of this parameter is true and the request has an AWS signature, then only the topic owner and the subscription owner can unsubscribe the endpoint. The unsubscribe action requires AWS authentication.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: createPlatformApplication
operation.description: Creates a platform application object for one of the supported push notification services, such as APNS and GCM, to which devices and mobile apps may register.

parameter.name: name
parameter.description: Application name must be made up of only uppercase and lowercase ASCII letters, numbers, underscores, hyphens, and periods, and must be between 1 and 256 characters long.

parameter.name: platform
parameter.description: The following platforms are supported: ADM (Amazon Device Messaging), APNS (Apple Push Notification Service), APNS_SANDBOX, and GCM (Google Cloud Messaging).

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.description: The list of attributes.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: createPlatformEndpoint
operation.description: Creates an endpoint for a device and mobile app on one of the supported push notification services. CreatePlatformEndpoint requires the PlatformApplicationArn that is returned from CreatePlatformApplication.

parameter.name: platformApplicationArn
parameter.description: PlatformApplicationArn returned from CreatePlatformApplication is used to create an endpoint.

parameter.name: token
parameter.description: Unique identifier created by the notification service for an app on a device. The specific name for Token will vary, depending on which notification service is being used. For example, when using APNS as the notification service, you need the device token. Alternatively, when using GCM or ADM, the device token equivalent is called the registration ID.

parameter.name: customUserData
parameter.description: Arbitrary user data to associate with the endpoint. Amazon SNS does not use this data. The data must be in UTF-8 format and less than 2KB.

parameter.name: attributes
parameter.description: The list of attributes.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: createTopic
operation.description: The CreateTopic action creates a topic to which notifications can be published. Users can create at most 100 topics

parameter.name: topicName
parameter.description: The name of the topic you want to create.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: deleteEndpoint
operation.description: Deletes the endpoint for a device and mobile app from Amazon SNS.

parameter.name: endpointArn
parameter.description: EndpointArn of endpoint to delete.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: deletePlatformApplication
operation.description: Deletes a platform application object for one of the supported push notification services, such as APNS and GCM.

parameter.name: platformApplicationArn
parameter.description: PlatformApplicationArn of platform application object to delete.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: deleteTopic
operation.description: The DeleteTopic action deletes a topic and all its subscriptions. Deleting a topic might prevent some messages previously sent to the topic from being delivered to subscribers. This action is idempotent, so deleting a topic that does not exist does not result in an error.

parameter.name: topicArn
parameter.description: The ARN of the topic you want to delete.

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: getEndpointAttributes
operation.description: Retrieves the endpoint attributes for a device on one of the supported push notification services, such as GCM and APNS.

parameter.name: endpointArn

parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy

parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy

operation.name: getSubscriptionAttributes
operation.description: The GetSubscriptionAttributes action returns all of the properties of a subscription.

parameter.description: The ARN of the subscription whose properties you want to get

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

operation.name: getTopicAttributes
operation.description: The GetTopicAttributes action returns all of the properties of a topic. Topic properties returned might differ based on the authorization of the user.

parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

operation.name: listEndpointsByPlatformApplication
operation.description: Lists the endpoints and endpoint attributes for devices in a supported push notification service, such as GCM and APNS.

parameter.name: arn

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

operation.name: listSubscriptions
operation.description: The ListSubscriptions action returns a list of the requester's subscriptions. Each call returns a limited list of subscriptions, up to 100. If there are more subscriptions, a NextToken is also returned. Use the NextToken parameter in a new ListSubscriptions call to get further results.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: listSubscriptionsByTopic
operation.description: The SubscriptionsByTopic action returns a list of the subscriptions to a specific topic. Each call returns a limited list of subscriptions, up to 100. If there are more subscriptions, a NextToken is also returned. Use the NextToken parameter in a new SubscriptionsByTopic call to get further results.

parameter.name: arn
parameter.description: The ARN of the topic.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: listTopics
operation.description: The ListTopics action returns a list of the requester's topics. Each call returns a limited list of topics, up to 100. If there are more topics, a NextToken is also returned. Use the NextToken parameter in a new ListTopics call to get further results.

parameter.name: streamingStrategy
parameter.description: Configure if repeatable streams should be used and their behaviour

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: publish
operation.description: The Publish action sends a message to all of a topic's subscribed endpoints. When a messageId is returned, the message has been saved and Amazon SNS will attempt to deliver it to the topic's subscribers shortly. The format of the outgoing message to each subscribed endpoint depends on the notification protocol selected.

parameter.name: message
parameter.description: The message you want to send to the topic.

parameter.name: subject
parameter.description: Optional parameter to be used as the "Subject" line when the message is delivered to email endpoints. This field will also be included, if present, in the standard JSON messages delivered to other endpoints.

parameter.name: messageStructure
parameter.description: Set MessageStructure to json if you want to send a different message for each protocol.

parameter.name: messageAttributes
parameter.description: The message attributes.

parameter.name: topicArn
parameter.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the topic you want to publish to..

parameter.name: targetArn
parameter.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the platform endpoint you want to publish to.

parameter.name: phoneNumber
parameter.description: The Phone Number of the device you want to publish to.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: removePermission
operation.description: The RemovePermission action removes a statement from a topic's access control policy.

parameter.name: topicArn
parameter.description: The ARN of the topic whose access control policy you wish to modify.

parameter.name: label
parameter.description: The unique label of the statement you want to remove.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

parameter.name: attributeName
parameter.description: The name of the attribute.

parameter.name: attributeValue
parameter.description: The value of the attribute.

parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

operation.name: setTopicAttributes
operation.description: The TopicAttributes action allows a topic owner to set an attribute of the topic to a new value.

parameter.name: topicArn
parameter.description: The ARN of the topic.

parameter.name: attributeName
parameter.description: The name of the attribute.

parameter.name: attributeValue
parameter.description: The value of the attribute.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: subscribe
operation.description: The Subscribe action prepares to subscribe an endpoint by sending the endpoint a confirmation message. To actually create a subscription, the endpoint owner must call the confirmSubscription action with the token from the confirmation message. Confirmation tokens are valid for three days.

parameter.name: topicArn
parameter.description: The ARN of the topic you want to subscribe to.

parameter.name: protocol
parameter.description: The protocol you want to use.

parameter.name: endpoint
parameter.description: The endpoint that you want to receive notifications. Endpoints vary by protocol:

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors

operation.name: unsubscribe
operation.description: The Unsubscribe action deletes a subscription. If the subscription requires authentication for deletion, only the owner of the subscription or the its topic's owner can unsubscribe, and an AWS signature is required. If the Unsubscribe call does not require authentication and the requester is not the subscription owner, a final cancellation message is delivered to the endpoint, so that the endpoint owner can easily resubscribe to the topic if the Unsubscribe request was unintended.

parameter.name: subscriptionArn
parameter.description: The ARN of the subscription to be deleted.

parameter.name: target
parameter.description: The name of a variable on which the operation's output will be placed

parameter.name: targetValue
parameter.description: An expression that will be evaluated against the operation's output and the outcome of that expression will be stored in the target variable

parameter.name: reconnectionStrategy
parameter.description: A retry strategy in case of connectivity errors
